intro: Sideroxylon laurifolium, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and broad, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by woody, elongated fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forest and woodland habitats. Due to its aromatic wood, it has historical and cultural significance in traditional medicine and craftsmanship.
